This time, the awarded building was Casa Vidal, a residential project located at 1st Street in San Felipe, Casco Viejo. Congratulations to everyone involved! restoring a...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

For third year in a row, the architectural firm Hache Uve has won a Premio Magna given by the Panamanian Architecture and Engineer Association. This time, the awarded building was Casa Vidal, a residential project located at 1st Street in San Felipe, Casco Viejo.  Congratulations to everyone involved! restoring a building in Casco is not a one man show. From land owners to designers, to builders and project managers, there are thousands of hours put into a single unit.

Here is Hache Uve`s page on the project: CLICK HERE.

And here is a small video with photos of the building:

item.title: Street Birthday Party
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Loved street birthday parties. One of my earliest memories was hitting a piñata so hard I broke the wooden stick, which ended up hitting an adult several feet away. Hey, no one told him to be that close! Then there is another one, where a piñata finally broke and candies...
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Loved street birthday parties. One of my earliest memories was hitting a piñata so hard I broke the wooden stick, which ended up hitting an adult several feet away. Hey, no one told him to be that close! Then there is another one, where a piñata finally broke and candies fell from the sky and somehow all of a sudden it was ok to jump in there and grab as much as you could, by force if you needed to. Awesome. But in today`s world, when was the last time you saw a street birthday party? well, actually Saturday in Casco Viejo.

It is such a teasing game. The adults at the top raise and lower the piñata so the baby or the kid can´t get it too easily. But eventually they do, sometimes the adult gave them the opportunity, sometimes (with older kids) they totally had to earn it.  And when the treasure falls down, you can imagine what`s next. Chaos, tears, laughter. And then dance and sharing. Food comes, mothers are on top of everything and everyone sing the famous song, in English first and Spanish later with some salsa tempo and a bonus track about ice cream. Cultural note here: you can´t escape the singing part, even when you are a full grown up, suit and tie adult. You will sing Feliz Cumpleaños. If you are not used to it, my best advice is just to own it!

So here it is: the birthday party we bumped into on Saturday after the Esperanza Tour at Fortaleza. Loved the little kid… so serious, he was swinging like pro baseball player!

item.title: Casco Viejo Events June 2014
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama Casco Viejo Don´t know what to do or where to go in June? check Casco Viejo`s events for the month: June 7th: Indian Culture at Plaza V Centenario: starting at 2 p.m. from Miramar Hotel, this festival will parade chariots bearing representations of Jagannatha Baladeva and Subhadra up to Casco Viejo`s Plaza V Centenario....
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo

Don´t know what to do or where to go in June? check Casco Viejo`s events for the month:

June 7th: Indian Culture at Plaza V Centenario: starting at 2 p.m. from Miramar Hotel, this festival will parade chariots bearing representations of Jagannatha Baladeva and Subhadra up to Casco Viejo`s Plaza V Centenario. They`ll have dance, dramas and a big vegetarian banquet, everything for free!

Now until June 8th: Saint Malo Music Festival. At the Anita Villalaz and National Theaters. info: www.asmfestivalpanama.com

June 7th: National Theater, 6:30 p.m.  “Opera Live” show. 11 singers. Contact “Asociacion Grupo Lirico de Panama” in Facebook for tickets.

June 9th to the 13th: XI International Encounter of Guitar. Participants from Nicaragua, Finland, USA, Cuba, China and Panama. National Theater. Tickets at Blockbuster and Tuboleto. Info at 226-4887 or 213-2402

June 12th: Fundraising for the Olga Sinclair Foundation with cocktail at the American Trade Hotel, 6 p.m. Lupita Barriga will present her fashion show “Roma Collection”.

June 15th: Anita Villalaz Theater, 7 p.m. Minguet Quartet. A free show by the Goethe institute, the German Embassy and Deutscheschule Nikolaus Kopernikus. Details: Facebook.com/Embajada Alemana

Also, here is June`s calendar for events at the Danilo Pérez Jazz Bar:

item.title: Made in Casco: Unique Gifts
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo If you are looking for a unique gift to take home, something Panamanian but sophisticated, that was not only made in Casco but helps directly communities improve their quality of life you have two beautiful choices: Papiro y Yo and Karavan. Papiro y Yo works mainly with communities in the...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

If you are looking for a unique gift to take home, something Panamanian but sophisticated, that was not only made in Casco but helps directly communities improve their quality of life you have two beautiful choices: Papiro y Yo and Karavan.

Papiro y Yo works mainly with communities in the interior, towards Penonomé and what we call the “dry arch”.  Karavan works with the indigenous communities and with the African descendants that live in Portobelo. Between the two you cover a big part of Panama`s cultural rainbow!

While part of their production is at those communities, they also produce “in house”. Here is the info on each one:

Papiro y Yo: located at 4th Street, betwen Central Avenue and B Avenue, entering by Casa Góngora or if you are at Plaza Bolivar entering by Casablanca.  Here is their FACEBOOK page.

Karavan: located at 3rd Street and A Avenue, it is next to an easy landmark: the Arco Chato.  HERE is their website with contact info.

item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Just before the ramp that takes you into San Felipe, you`ll see a small pub at the bottom: La Rana Dorada, Casco`s small beer factory. Different flavors and textures, the master brewers and clients at Rana have fun and their product is famous in Panama City.

They are also hosts of the Rana Dorada festival, which is organized by a group of scientists at Smithsonian who are studying Panama`s unique Golden Frog.

Here is their Facebook page: HERE

item.title: Made in Casco: Fashion
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo For those with a taste for something new, made to fit, not for a mall, having a personal fashion designer might be a dream come true. Many think this is an expensive dream. It doesn´t have to be. Just call Gisela Sánchez. Now opening her own atelier in Casco Viejo,...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

For those with a taste for something new, made to fit, not for a mall, having a personal fashion designer might be a dream come true. Many think this is an expensive dream. It doesn´t have to be. Just call Gisela Sánchez.

Now opening her own atelier in Casco Viejo, she is blending her fashion designer (and producer) work with uncommon retail products such as vintage clothing and unusual brands. It will be a space for fashion creativity… at an affordable price. The name of her shop will be “Mamitas”, and her own brand is “Taller de Gisela”.

Where are they opening: Casa Arias, 6th Street and A Avenue.

When: May 30th, party at 7 p.m.!

Email her at: tallerdegisela@gmail.com

Facebook page: HERE

For years, I had seen neighbor Mitchelle Quiñones with the most interesting jewelry on her. Never asked where she got it, until this past week when she...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

I`m liking this “Made in Casco” concept every day more. It is allowing me to see this neighborhood differently and discovering cool stuff.

For years,  I had seen neighbor Mitchelle Quiñones with the most interesting jewelry on her. Never asked where she got it, until this past week when she told me she had a workshop in Casco and was producing her own line from there. Fantastic!

She has her own Facebook Page and is starting to promote her brand. Check it out!

Photos by Jorge Duarte

item.title: TEDx Panama City at Teatro Amador
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo I couldn´t believe it. I was in a line (and a long one!) to get into Teatro Amador. But it wasn´t the latest concert of the latest celebrity. We were all there to assist to TEDx Panama City, and the conversation was to be about culture and identity. We had...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

I couldn´t believe it. I was in a line (and a long one!) to get into Teatro Amador. But it wasn´t the latest concert of the latest celebrity. We were all there to assist to TEDx Panama City, and the conversation was to be about culture and identity.

We had a blast. From the bizarre to the concrete, speakers brought a broad spectrum, but everything related to education, cultural manifestations, cultural projects, cultural reflections and meditations.  It closed with Panamanian saxophonist Yahaziel Arrocha playing his own interpretation of Suspiros de una Fea and with spoken poetry by the Congo community from Portobelo.

I want to congratulate the team that made this possible, specially to Alfonso Grimaldo. Paraphrasing TED`s moto, I think these are passions worth spreading.

Big smile and down to earth personality, he approaches work with the elegant simplicity of honest quality. Creative without compromising the product! works side by side with his team.

item.title: “Made in Casco Viejo”: old trades by new artisans
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo. Checking out old adds from Panama “way back when”, I had a to smile on the sort of items you would find in the stores. Mainly fabrics, oils, leather, lace and other primary goods. Other adds would be for shoemakers, tailors ,pharmacies that knew how to mix herbs , seamstresses...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo.

Checking out old adds from Panama “way back when”, I had a to smile on the sort of items you would find in the stores. Mainly fabrics, oils, leather, lace and other primary goods. Other adds would be for shoemakers, tailors ,pharmacies that knew how to mix herbs , seamstresses that were able to make a wedding dress from scratch and keep her work discreet so her clients could boast they had brought the dress “from Europe”.

It is true that our world has lost touch with those old trades. However, a new generation of artisans/artists have moved in and opened shop in Casco.  From fashion to food & beverage, all of them creative minds, creative hands. Not sure if they`ve gotten recognized yet, but just in case, I`m making my own series called “Made in Casco”.

Being half Italian I have to start with pasta: “Casco Made Pasta”: fresh pasta made at restaurant Da Vinci. Owned by Juan and Zummy, the pasta is made by María, who has been working with the couple for twelve years and was trained by Juan. They extend the “home made” approach to everything in their kitchen, but they are the only ones making, packaging and selling their own pasta.

Where is Da Vinci? You`ll find them just coming up the hill entering San Felipe. Look to your right, they`ll be there almost next to Luna`s Castle.

How to contact them? Phones: 262-6285  262-8974

I really enjoyed it! it was super fun and challenging at the same time. But strangely, even if the photos below look super difficult, they were not. item.title: Casco´s school bazar a success
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo   This past weekend, Casco Viejo´s kinder had a beautiful bazar. The purpose was to fundraise for the scholarship program that will allow children from Casco´s community to attend. This school is a Montessori school and we are so proud of it. Has grown little by little, literally from the...
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

 

This past weekend, Casco Viejo´s kinder had a beautiful bazar. The purpose was to fundraise for the scholarship program that will allow children from Casco´s community to attend. This school is a Montessori school and we are so proud of it. Has grown little by little, literally from the houses of parents who believed in educating their children in a different way and in Casco´s environment. Now, they have a small building, with different classrooms, and a dedicated group of teachers.  The day was awesome. Everyone came to support, and old friends met new friends!

If you are interested in the school, please contact Keren Levanon at: 6444-7452

item.title: How to fit 30 Parkings in Casco Viejo
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panamá, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo   31 Actually. And in a historic building with more than 800 mt2 of office space on the top. How? We are thrilled to announce that developer Conservatorio (our mother company) has brought what is the first mechanized parking system to Panama. This system, by the German company Klaus Multiparking...
item.content:encoded:
Panamá, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

 

31 Actually. And in a historic building with more than 800 mt2 of office space on the top.  How?

We are thrilled to announce that developer Conservatorio (our mother company) has brought what is the first mechanized parking system to Panama.  This system, by the German company Klaus Multiparking is simply put, the future, not only for Casco Viejo but for Panama City.

The system is part of El Colegio, Casco´s first Grade A office building, opening in May 2018. Open office floorplans, high ceilings, balcony, roof terrace with stunning views… and parking.  With 40 years of experience in building this type of systems, we are very proud to be the first ones in Panama, and to make this statement from Casco Viejo. Cities grow, and spaces have to get more compact and efficient. New solutions have to be applied, and technology has proven to be a critical ally.  For years, Conservatorio has been leading the market through sustainable urban revitalization, seeking and applying solutions to complex urban challenges using creativity, and out of the box ideas to tackle problems.

El Colegio is the perfect corner for small to medium businesses in the creative , cultural or technological business.  Family offices and even small educational institutions.

For more information, take a look at our microsite : HERE

Or email us! patrizia@arcoproperties.com

item.title: School Library Renovated by Casco Antiguo Spanish School
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Antiguo, Casco Viejo   A school library might seem something most take for granted, but for most public schools in Panama it is a challenge to keep up looking fresh and with new material (hopefully in two languages!). That is why we were super excited to be invited by Casco Antiguo´s Spanish School...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Antiguo, Casco Viejo

 

A school library might seem something most take for granted, but for most public schools in Panama it is a challenge to keep up looking fresh and with new material (hopefully in two languages!). That is why we were super excited to be invited by Casco Antiguo´s Spanish School to the inauguration of the newly refurbished library at the Escuela de México. Casco´s Spanish School took the initiative along with their students, parents of Escuela de México and teachers to re paint and make the library more functional. Children were smiling, all happy to see the old space with a new face and new books!

Now that it is done, if you have books you would like to donate, you can bring them to Casco´s Spanish School at A Avenue and 5th street, and they´ll make sure to take them to the school.

Congratulations to everyone who made this possible, I don´t know the name of everyone involved, specially the donor who made a wonderful “Spanglish” speech! Thanks to David to make it happen and for the invitation to be there at the inauguration.

item.title: When it really matters.
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Last Sunday, Casco Viejo`s community came together to help a large number of families victim to an accidental fire. In a matter of hours, lists and donations were organized, by 6 a.m. on the following day a team was in place with tasks, headquarters and social media strategies. It made...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Last Sunday, Casco Viejo`s community came together to help a large number of families victim to an accidental fire. In a matter of hours, lists and donations were organized, by 6 a.m. on the following day a team was in place with tasks, headquarters and social media strategies.  It made me think a lot about Casco Viejo, and its true value. The value of a place is tied up to its community, to its ability to work together and get through difficult times when things get tough. Somehow this doesn´t make it to the “real estate” analysis, but it should, because striped from  high end finishes, double panned windows, nice facades and sidewalks, what really matters is the strength of the human web that not only connects physically in the same space and time… but feels connected to each other.

The strength of Casco are its Casconians. And note that by Casconians I mean every Casco lover out there, we are all connected, and this trial was the real proof of it: people came from everywhere to help. Thank you so much to each and every one of you. To the NGO`s who were coordinating and working their heads off: Aprojusan, Fundación Calicanto, AVACA. Amazing. To all the businesses that didn´t even flinch in pulling out their contacts and see who knew who so that we could get what we needed. Super Thumbs Up.  To all the volunteers … you rock!!!

item.title: Fitness in Casco Viejo
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo 5:58 a.m. and I already feel my dog`s axiety rising. She knows my alarm goes off at 6 a.m. but still starts stretching at 5:30 ish letting me know she won´t allow for a minute past 6 a.m. to go out. Don´t get me wrong, I love working out in...
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

5:58 a.m. and I already feel my dog`s axiety rising. She knows my alarm goes off at 6 a.m. but still starts stretching at 5:30 ish letting me know she won´t allow for a minute past 6 a.m. to go out.  Don´t get me wrong, I love working out in the mornings, but just in case there is ever a day I don´t want to do it… well, there is always Chispa.

This time I decided to take photos along the way, for those considering moving to Casco and asking themselves about gyms and options to keep fit. Most Casconians love to be outdoors.  In the morning, you see people walking Las Bovedas, but if you like jogging probably you`ll be heading to the Cinta.

6:10 a.m. I`m ready, leach in hand with plenty of bags, we are out. First stop, the “cancha” by the Presidential palace. Already the Presidential police is having fun, playing soccer or sometimes basketball.

Some of them have decided to work out at the Plaza V Centenario, right below.

I was too early, but usually around 6:30 a.m. you can see some people practicing Tai Chi here

For those who like tenis, a small jog or 10 minute walk will warm you up:

And for those who like light equipment, right next to the tenis field:

Coming back, you can always stop at the fish market and get fresh catch of the day.

6:39 a.m., after walking, jogging and dragging my dog …I`m back at Calle 4ta.  Enough cardio, it is time to get serious. TLG Gym is at the end of the street, into the Santa Familia building.  Here John has a crossfit training for the morning and also does personal training. No machines and no need for them!  Kettlebells, weights, strings, ropes, medicine balls, boxing and jiu jitsu equipment.  Twenty minutes of any of that and you have earned your breakfast!

item.title: Recycling art, urbanism and fashion
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo There was a lot happening this weekend, I`m sorry I couldn´t go to everything. From what I did manage to get to, here were my top picks: The urbanism talk at American Trade Hotel on how social housing can regenerate societies. I was glad to learn that there are several...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

There was a lot happening this weekend, I`m sorry I couldn´t go to everything. From what I did manage to get to, here were my top picks:

The urbanism talk at American Trade Hotel on how social housing can regenerate societies.  I was glad to learn that there are several ongoing projects in Panama trying to apply the concepts discussed in the talk. All based on human scale, not on “car scale”. As in our beloved Casco!

The recycling art at MACRO. Yes, everyone came for the fashion, I came for the garbage… Really loved the plastic bottle sculptures at the park! Turtles, dolphins, capibaras and more out of water plastic bottles. Heard San Francisco (USA) banned them? What a bold step! we do need some inspiration…

There was also Jonathan Harker`s & Donna Conlon`s video called “Domino Effect”. It was cleverly projected at the side of La Merced Church, where people gathered to enjoy it.  Have to say, it has an hypnotizing effect! It will be one of the pieces traveling soon to be shown at Art Basel, Miami.

item.title: More Events This Week: Entrepreneurship, Urbanism, Art
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón

Take a look at “We are So Miami”. Enjoy also the work of artist Igor Kourany at Casa Góngora. Featured artists include: Fabrizio Arrieta, Stefan Benchoam, Otto Berchem, Jose...
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Interesting conversations happening this upcoming weeks in Casco Viejo:

Thursday, March 13th: Diablo Rosso takes an art collection to Art Basel. Take a look at “We are So Miami”. Enjoy also the work of artist Igor Kourany at Casa Góngora. Featured artists include: Fabrizio Arrieta, Stefan Benchoam, Otto Berchem, Jose Castrellon,Donna Conlon/ Jonathan Harker, Karlo Ibarra, Miky Fabrega, Pilar Moreno, Humberto Velez.

Where? Diablo Rosso, Calle 6ta. 7 p.m.

Where? Casa Góngora, Calle 4ta and Central, 7 p.m.

Friday, March 14th: an Entrepreneurial Forum with 9 speakers coming from all over the place: New York, Peru, Guatemala, Colombia, México and Panama.

Where? American Trade Hotel- Cost: $25 Reservations : CLICK HERE

Saturday, March 15th: an urbanism/architecture talk about the future of cities and the issues of cars. They will also follow up on a previous workshop about how social architecture can help regenerate cities.

Where? American Trade Hotel, Sat March 15th at 6 p.m.

If you are lucky, Nature will give you the gift of being right under a blooming Guayacan and shower you with yellow and pink flowers. Knowing that this tree only blooms once a year and the flowers last only a...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

After crazy carnivals, there is nothing like a quiet moment. If you are lucky, Nature will give you the gift of being right under a blooming Guayacan and shower you with yellow and pink flowers.  Knowing that this tree only blooms once a year and the flowers last only a week, makes that time in place even more special.

It was organized by residents, businesses and a regional group called Cali 7 with members who traveled from Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua and Costa Rica to participate. Thanks to all AVACA members who participated, and specially to Gisela...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

What a crazy Friday! here are the photos of Casco`s first Kids Carnival. It was organized by residents, businesses and a regional group called Cali 7 with members who traveled from Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua and Costa Rica to participate.  Thanks to all AVACA members who participated, and specially to Gisela Timmins, Dayanara and Miriam who worked so hard to put it together.  And to the businesses who donated to make this happen: Las Clementinas, Arco Properties, Conservatorio S.A., Casco Station (hope not be forgetting anyone!). Thanks also to Gio from Aprojusan and for the dynamic group of the dance program Enlaces from Fundacion Calicanto.  My favorite part, though, was the one organized by John at the TLG Gym…Fantastic!!!

item.title: Carnivals are here!

item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

And the whole country goes into a hiatus, nothing gets done, and we are proud of it. Time to celebrate and wear strange costumes. But my favorite new tradition is the children`s carnival at Casco Viejo, which will start today at 2:30 p.m. in Santa Familia, 4th Street.   Can´t wait to sack race and run holding a spoon in my mouth with a lime on top. Wait a minute… wasn´t that for children? hummm…

While Carnival is known more as a party holiday, Casco Viejo`s community would like to give it a different twist. Business...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Do you remember playing sack race and running around with a spoon in your mouth balancing a lime? if you are Generation Next or before (sorry Millenials!!!) you do.

While Carnival is known more as a party holiday, Casco Viejo`s community would like to give it a different twist.  Business employees and AVACA members have organized a small “Carnavalito”, a day of vintage games for children.  Everyone is invited!

When: Friday, February 28th, starting at 2:30 p.m.

Where: Santa Familia building, 4th Street and A Avenue

What to bring: comfortable clothing

If you would like to volunteer or donate for this event, contact Gisela Timmins at assistantmanager@conservatoriosa.com

item.title: First office building in Casco Viejo: El Colegio
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo, Real Estate, Offices For years, we`ve been faced with the same situation: young entrepreneurs desperately looking for office space in Casco Viejo, only to end up in an apartment or expensive ground floor commercial locale. For all of them, great news! Casco Viejo is turning another milestone: its first Office...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo, Real Estate, Offices

For years, we`ve been faced with the same situation: young entrepreneurs desperately looking for office space in Casco Viejo, only to end up in an apartment or expensive ground floor commercial locale.  For all of them, great news!  Casco Viejo is turning another milestone: its first Office Building. Welcome El Colegio.

The property used to be the “María Inmaculada” school for women only (back then), therefore its name “El Colegio”.  The school later moved out of Casco and now the building is being restored into cool offices using the original floors and keeping charming features like the internal garden with the original mosaic of the “Inmaculada”.  Currently under construction, first offices will be delivered May  2014.

The full project will involve two buildings, the first one already available and almost ready to deliver 12 office units and a large commercial space. The property will have access to private parking managed by Casco Parking.   An unprecedented 448 mt2 groundfloor retail and café space will be available for those with an interesting concept that will bring value to Casco Viejo and cater the needs of the office compound.

For rent only! if you are interested, please contact us at :

clara   or   patrizia  at  arcoproperties.com

item.title: El Chorrillo City Tour: Panama`s history & Popular Culture
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo A couple of weeks ago I joined Felix McFresh and his friend Alberto on an interesting city tour of Chorrillo. These two “chorrilleros” are passionate about their neighborhood and the special things that can only be found there as part of our historic and cultural heritage. Chorrillo is known today...
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

A couple of weeks ago I joined Felix McFresh and his friend Alberto on an interesting city tour of Chorrillo. These two “chorrilleros” are passionate about their neighborhood and the special things that can only be found there as part of our historic and cultural heritage.

Chorrillo is known today as a low income town, which has struggled all its life. While this might be so, it is also true that  Chorrillo has an intimate connection with Panama`s history and that there is plenty of good stuff to see and learn.

The neighborhood was known initially as the living quarters of the workers of the Panama Canal. It does hold the key for our history before that: its name means “little water stream”, which referred to the small fresh water river that ran from Ancon Hill down to this field, and where  people in Casco Viejo back in colonial times would go to source water.  The river is almost gone, in itself a lesson of how cities erase our natural history. Should we ignore this? made me meditate a lot about what growth happens on top of things and resources.

Considered “outside the city”, this is where the cemetery is located. All of our greatest historic figures are buried there. Some you might know only because of the references on names of streets and monuments. For example, the beautiful paseo covered by flowers that takes you to Las Bovedas is called Paseo Esteban Huertas. I “bumped into him” at Chorrillo. There was also a big pavilion for the Amador Guerrero family, him being Panama`s first President.  It is also fun to scout for foreign names and years. I wondered what was the story behind everyone, and was surprised to find that many of the sculptures were made in Italy!

You also bump into old traditions that refuse to die. There is the last guy who knows and actually uses a Heidelberg printer. Fascinating machine. Original! Then there is the hat guy, who will fit any hat to your personalized size. And the tailor, who in a small shop where you barely fit, can make you a custom made Guayabera shirt.  He has dressed Presidents, famous boxers and made costumes for movies.

Roaming around Calle 8, we passed by the famous fried fish corner. And who do we bump into? Roberto “Mano de Piedra” Durán, having a couple of beers with his friends.

If you have an adventurous heart, and would love to know more about the popular roots of Panama, this tour is for you. Felix is not bilingual, but can arrange for a translator. Contact him at: 6152-9013.

item.title: New Art Space in Casco Viejo
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo People keep opening spaces to art in Casco Viejo, this time by Miguel Lombardo, right on top of Dodo at Las Bovedas in Plaza Francia. Welcome “Casasola”! The space is featuring right now two art projects, one called “Ferretería Internacional” and the other one re creates an old style pharmacy....
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

People keep opening spaces to art in Casco Viejo, this time by Miguel Lombardo, right on top of Dodo at Las Bovedas in Plaza Francia. Welcome “Casasola”!

The space is featuring right now two art projects, one called “Ferretería Internacional” and the other one re creates an old style pharmacy. For Ferretería, the artist took furniture from an old hardware store and re created furniture almost like a sculpture. The specific hardware store he was re creating actually existed, and he got original pieces from the family who still owned a bunch of stuff. The result is beautiful, it makes you feel like a kid in a candy store: wanting to touch everything.

Likewise, the “pharmacy” section also re created this type of store which back in the 20`s could very well sell you a cough remedy next to gun powder and lace. Miguel got the accounting books, which are in themselves pieces of art: you can almost trace the love put by the accountant in tracing every word and number. No one writes like that anymore! not one mistake, each line clean and clear.

To visit the space and get a tour of the pieces, please contact Miguel at 228-9105. Email: miguel@casasola.cc  www.casasola.cc

item.title: “Felt Part of the Neighborhood”, French Ambassador on Casco Viejo
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo The life of a diplomat is to travel every four years (or less, depending on the country) from country to country, spreading good will on each one. Their range of experiences on places to live and work is enormous. Today, at La Prensa, there was a note about French Ambassador...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

The life of a diplomat is to travel every four years (or less, depending on the country) from country to country, spreading good will on each one. Their range of experiences on places to live and work is enormous.

Today, at La Prensa, there was a note about French Ambassador Hugues Goisbault leaving soon, but not before praising his lifestyle in Casco Viejo. According to the note, he will have “strong memories” from Casco Viejo, where he “felt part of the neighborhood, protected”.  He recalled fondly how children in the plaza knew him, and how it was to work at the French Embassy located at Las Bovedas (French Plaza).

Would like to thank him for such heart felt words, and hopefully he`ll be back soon!  Here is the full La Prensa note (in Spanish).

item.title: Generation Peace Academy works with AVACA`s Casco Recicla Program
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo During 2012, a group of Generation Peace Academy volunteers came to Casco Viejo to work with Casco`s neighborhood Association (AVACA) in an important awareness program about garbage disposal and direct street intervention. This year, they joined hands again to work on recycling, the natural next step. For the first time...
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

During 2012, a group of Generation Peace Academy volunteers came to Casco Viejo to work with Casco`s neighborhood Association (AVACA) in an  important awareness program about garbage disposal and direct street intervention.  This year, they joined hands again to work on recycling, the natural next step.

For the first time ever, a survey of how much recycling material is being produced at restaurants is being made. Additionally, GPA volunteers are working with children from the community (Aprojusan) doing beach cleanings and building an herbs garden that will help local restaurants to have native species grown in house, and more involved in educational programs about nutrition for the community.

We are very proud of the work done by Generation Peace Academy, Aprojusan and all the members of AVACA involved in the activities. Step by step, Casco is moving towards its dream of being one of the greatest historic cities in the world, not only because of its architecture, but because of the love of its people.

Thanks again guys! you rock!

item.title: Spring Festival (Chinese New Year) 2014
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo Casco Antiguo Welcome to the year of the “wooden horse”! Year 4712 according to the Chinese calendar, and this particular symbol refers to optimism and joy. Today, Panama`s Chinese community starts celebrating today (and for the next 15 days) with music, fireworks, dance and traditional rituals. Today, sponsored by the Chinese business...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo Casco Antiguo

Welcome to the year of the “wooden horse”! Year 4712 according to the Chinese calendar, and this particular symbol refers to optimism and joy. Today, Panama`s Chinese community starts celebrating today (and for the next 15 days) with music, fireworks, dance and traditional rituals. Today, sponsored by the Chinese business community, they`ll have a special show at the Figali Center starting at 2 p.m.  (for free) with dance, acrobats and highlights of Chinese culture.

If this is your first Año Nuevo Chino in Panama, you might notice that the first “China Town” is still in Casco Viejo, so probably this weekend will be a festive scenario by B Avenue. This community, however, has extended and have now their stronghold in El Dorado, where most activities are traditionally held.
One of the things people are surprised about when coming to Panama is how much Panamanians love dim sum or “Chinese breakfast”. Usually you have to fight your way through the most respected restaurants such as Lung Fung and Golden Unicorn. I bet this Sunday will be extra special, so if you are thinking on going, be there early!

To everyone celebrating this weekend: happy Wooden Horse Year!

item.title: Casco Recicla Art Fundraise
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Tuesday, the Casco Viejo Neighborhood Association (AVACA) organized a fundraising event to raise funds for its recycling program. The event was at Nuratti, a small but chic hotel in Casco Viejo. The event was a silent auction of art pieces made with material from the recycling center and themes about...
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Tuesday, the Casco Viejo Neighborhood Association (AVACA) organized a fundraising event to raise funds for its recycling program. The event was at Nuratti, a small but chic hotel in Casco Viejo. The event was a silent auction of art pieces made with material from the recycling center and themes about nature. There were also a couple of interactive pieces, where the public was able to participate creating a map of Panama with bottle caps and a tower of gliding paint.

The event was super fun and a success! The program will be able to buy the initial equipment to start recollecting recycling material from homes and restaurants in Casco Viejo.  More coming soon, as so much is needed. We would like to thank specially organizers Ingrid Moore, Tarina Rodriguez and Jennifer Hotsko.  Hotel Nuratti for donating the space and artists Jorge Suanzes and Alejandra Tabares for donating their beautiful work. Loved the chandelier!

Congratulations to all!

One of my favorite spots, behind the Escuela de Estados Unidos by the Masonic Lodge, has opened a music venue called “La Buat“, a word game for La Boite, the old dancing discos that back in the 50`s would...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Calle Doce (12th Street) is starting to get some interesting activities! One of my favorite spots, behind the Escuela de Estados Unidos by the Masonic Lodge, has opened a music venue called “La Buat“, a word game for La Boite, the old dancing discos that back in the 50`s would play Caribbean music such as Soka and Calypso.

On Thursday, January 30th, they`ll have a concert by Carlos Mendez, a Panamanian musician that lived in Mexico and is now back in town. Go check it out! here is the info:

item.title: Domino Effect by Jonathan Harker and Donna Conlon
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo For months I saw artists Donna Conlon and Jonathan Harker rescuing old bricks that were being replaced in Casco Viejo. Carrying them in buckets and then by cart, piling them without giving anything away. Last January 16th, in Diablo Rosso, we could see the final product: their piece “Domino Effect”...
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

For months I saw artists Donna Conlon and Jonathan Harker rescuing old bricks that were being replaced in Casco Viejo. Carrying them in buckets and then by cart, piling them without giving anything away. Last January 16th, in Diablo Rosso, we could see the final product: their piece “Domino Effect” portrays the bricks falling (or pushing?) through the whole Casco, in a commentary on how the city of Panama is changing, and how Casco Viejo – a World Heritage Site – has fought to keep its authenticity.

The bricks “walk you” through Casco, in a very zen way, with humor and love, with poetry. Someone said that at the end you felt those bricks were your friends, and maybe he was right.

Please pass by Diablo Rosso and check it out. They have the video and also the photographic show. Kudos to both Jonathan and Donna! the question remains… what are you going to do with your “friends” now?

item.title: Farm to Table: Donde José, Casco Viejo
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo I`m excited about Casco`s restaurants raising the bar in the City. Last week, Fish Market got featured in the magazine 9 -80, and the American Trade Restaurant opened doors featuring great stuff. This week I wanted to catch up and feature Donde José, a different type of restaurant that has...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

I`m excited about Casco`s restaurants raising the bar in the City. Last week, Fish Market got featured in the magazine 9 -80, and the American Trade Restaurant opened doors featuring great stuff. This week I wanted to catch up and feature Donde José, a different type of restaurant that has just opened doors and is worth mentioning for many reasons.

First, there is the food. You`d think talking about restaurants, this should always go first, but so many times it is not. I`m glad to report food is the whole point of it. José, a Panamanian chef with experience in faraway places such as Australia, is passionate about food and has a touch for unusual combinations. I`m still tasting that killer octopus, very good! He defines it as a New Panamanian Cuisine and takes pride on trying to bring out the soul of a culture through the authenticity and freshness of ingredients.

Second, is where the food comes from.  One of the things that makes this place great is the farm to table connection. José personally works with micro producers to get native ingredients that are little known (even to Panamanians) to work new recipes with his team through the week and be able to present the best he can to his 16 guests at his restaurant.

Third, you heard it right: only 16 seats. Chef`s table is four, the restaurant is only 16. A unique, intimate ambiance, where the chef gets to interact with every guest and share insight about the delicious 8 course meal that comes out of his kitchen. Open only 4 nights a week!

I`m not aware that anything like this has been done in Panama yet, and I`m glad Casco has been chosen to be on the leading edge once more. To make a reservation, please send an email to reservas@dondejose.com.

Thumbs up!

item.title: Great Before and After Photos of Casco Viejo, Panama
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo The Organización de Estados Ibero Americanos has just released a very interesting book with a really good collection of “before and after” photos of Casco Viejo. It was a treat even for our trained eyes, finding new photos and corners of life in Panama back in the day. A small...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

The Organización de Estados Ibero Americanos has just released a very interesting book with a really good collection of “before and after” photos of Casco Viejo.   It was a treat even for our trained eyes, finding new photos and corners of life in Panama back in the day.  A small peak for those who know Casco Viejo: can you recognize Plaza Bolivar (specifically Hotel Colombia)?

Not sure if this book will be for sale, but it should. We`ll try to find out if they`ll have it at the Canal Museum or maybe the recently restored Casa Soldado, where a new cultural space is being opened at the Paseo Esteban Huertas.

item.title: Jazz Community Celebrates Opening of Jazz Club in Casco Viejo
item.dc:creator: patrizia
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Last night, Panama`s jazz lovers gathered around the fire of music to celebrate the opening of the American Trade`s Jazz Bar. This has been a dream come true for everyone involved, a dream that started when Casco Viejo developer Conservatorio S.A. donated space to the Danilo Perez Foundation almost ten...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Last night, Panama`s jazz lovers gathered around the fire of music to celebrate the opening of the American Trade`s Jazz Bar. This has been a dream come true for everyone involved, a dream that started when Casco Viejo developer Conservatorio S.A. donated space to the Danilo Perez Foundation almost ten years ago to open and grow his jazz school in Panama.  The idea was to help raise the bar of music education in Panama, by not only creating a place for talent to develop, but to have a full cycle, where students from everywhere in Panama, including surrounding areas like Chorrillo and Santa Ana, could not only access first class education but also have a quality space to play as professionals.

The club has been designed for the true music fan, it is a “listening room” that will have the capacity to record concerts live. Upstairs, an events area more in the lounge style can accommodate social gatherings.

We would like to thank everyone who believed in this project and worked like crazy to get it to open. To Danilo Pérez and Patricia Zárate, and to the directors of Conservatorio S.A. for persevering in this vision of making Casco Viejo a great historic neighborhood, with content worth the beauty of this World Heritage Site.

To all the donors, fans and supporters of the Danilo Pérez Foundation and music in Panama: thank you as well!!  This was build with the effort of many with you in its heart. We hope you consider it an extension of your home.  Welcome and enjoy!

item.title: Open! Restaurant at American Trade Hotel
item.dc:creator: patrizia
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo This week, several things are happening around the Panama Jazz Fest. One of them is the opening of the American Trade Restaurant. We were there for the tastings and had a great time. Loved everything, but specially the chayote soup with chile poblano and the tuna. The ambiance is terrific,...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

This week, several things are happening around the Panama Jazz Fest. One of them is the opening of the American Trade Restaurant. We were there for the tastings and had a great time. Loved everything, but specially the chayote soup with chile poblano and the tuna.  The ambiance is terrific, your meal will have views to La Merced church and I think eventually they`ll open at Plaza Herrera.  My favorite house cocktail: Nebula . But if you are into vintage drinks, they`ve rescued a couple of recipes from old Colón (Caribbean side of Panama).  If you would like to explore them, ask for Haleluia or Bird of Paradise.  Cheers!

Website of American Trade Hotel Here

item.title: Surprises when restoring in Casco Viejo
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo You never know what you`ll find digging through the layers and layers of history while restoring a building in Casco Viejo. The photos below are from the former St. George school in Casco Viejo, which was thought to be a building from the 50`s. While restoring, the owners discovered beautiful...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

You never know what you`ll find digging through the layers and layers of history while restoring a building in Casco Viejo. The photos below are from the former St. George school in Casco Viejo, which was thought to be a building from the 50`s. While restoring, the owners discovered beautiful calicanto arches, way under the concrete layers. And now, at the very entrance, the original sign that reads: “Chaluja Alfonso”.

I had no clue what this meant, until this past weekend when passing by with my father and his friends who grew up in Casco, they stopped and said: ah! Almacén Chaluja!.   Memories came back, stories started to flow, ” do you remember when…?”.

I know, I love this town.

item.title: Tapalo at Tantalo
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Those who know me, know that recycling and garbage is one of my passions. Through Casco Viejo`s Neighborhood Association (AVACA) we collaborate fully with all the recycling initiatives, beach cleanings and general crazy stuff we come up to deal creatively with our material. So imagine my pleasure to walk into...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Those who know me, know that recycling and garbage is one of my passions. Through Casco Viejo`s Neighborhood Association (AVACA) we collaborate fully with all the recycling initiatives, beach cleanings and general crazy stuff we come up to deal creatively with our material. So imagine my pleasure to walk into Tantalo and see the most recent pieces by artist Michael Sager, who has been  working on “Tápalo”, a concept where he uses plastic bottle caps (in Spanish “tapa”) to make lamps and other objects.

If, like me, you have a strong interest in recycling, you can´t miss this show. All the lamp shades are by him, plus some of the pieces in the wall. And if you are interested in contacting the artist, let the staff at Tántalo know!

item.title: Pre Construction Projects for 2014 – Calle 6ta
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo This year is starting with really interesting projects on pre sales. We`ll feature one by one, starting with Casa Boyd, a project at Calle 6ta with a young vibe and a spacious offer. Only two apartments and one commercial space. The building is a modern, concrete building, with high ceilings...
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

This year is starting with really interesting projects on pre sales. We`ll feature one by one, starting with Casa Boyd, a project at Calle 6ta with a young vibe and a spacious offer.

Only two apartments and one commercial space. The building is a modern, concrete building, with high ceilings and a great sense of space.  We like both apartments as they fit very well into Casconian`s lifestyles: one is a loft one bedroom (Apartment No. 2 ) and the other one is a 1.5 bedrooms (Apartment No. 1), which means you have a second space to use as an office or guest bedroom.

A spacious balcony overlooking Calle 6ta, one of the widest side streets in San Felipe.

Below, a unique property: a 230 mt2 commercial space that is being planned as a restaurant. It will include an internal patio with a transparent roof, so you can use it all year round.  The locale can also be divided into smaller ones, in case a different concept is required.

They are an interior design store and services, with tons of really cute things for both home and office. My favorite stand is the one for the bathroom, with all these brushes made of natural fiber. Open from 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. ! here is their contact info if you want to check them out or hire their interior design services:

item.title: What to do and Where to go in 2014 Panama
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo New Year is coming! 2014 promises to be a busy year, and I`m glad to report cultural events will have a big share of the buzz. Today La Prensa reported a bunch of events throughout the next 12 months, here are the nearest to Casco in geography and heart: JANUARY:...
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

New Year is coming! 2014 promises to be a busy year, and I`m glad to report cultural events will have a big share of the buzz. Today La Prensa reported a bunch of events throughout the next 12 months, here are the nearest to Casco in geography and heart:

JANUARY:

13 to 18th: Panama Jazz FestivalWhere: mostly at City of Knowledge, Clayton, but Casco Viejo will have some of the gigs and after parties, specially with American Trade`s Jazz Bar opening.  It will be set up as a “listening room” so if you are serious about music, you`ll absolutely love this! www.panamajazzfestival.com

18th: Painting the 100 Years of the Panama Canal by Olga Sinclair`s Foundation.  Kids from the foundation she has in Casco will be gathering at Balboa, Paseo El Prado for a mega painting event. Bring your family! it`s free! info at: 393-6143

31st: National Concert Association Camp for Young Musicians will have a free concert at the Ateneo on City of Knowledge. Ten minutes away from Casco Viejo!

FEBRUARY:

7th to 9th: Three days of music, theater and more to celebrate the hundred years of the Panama Canal at the stairs of the Administration Building.

16th: Its Free Yoga Panama: free yoga class at Cinta Costera by New York yoga instructor Lauren Imparato.

MARCH

15th: Congo Festival in Portobelo! you can´t miss to check on one of Panama`s most colorful and interesting traditions. Stay at El Otro Lado!

15: Drum Night at City of Knowledge by Alfredo Hidrovo. Bring your kids, they`ll love the drumming workshop under the stars. Tel: 306-3700

27th to April 2nd:  Theater Festival (FAE) National Theater, Anita Villalaz Theater and several plazas in Casco Viejo.

APRIL

3rd to 9th: International Film Festival Panama (IFF Panama). Check out their website for information, this year they`ll have several screenings in Casco Viejo. www.iffpanama.org

22nd: Starting date of the National concert Association Season. They will have several concerts until October, some of them in City of Knowledge, some in Casco Viejo`s National Theater. Info: 214-4848

JUNE:

9th to 13th: Guitar Festival at the National Theater.

There were other events, but places yet to be defined. So, write these down and have fun!!! Looking forward to 2014!

item.title: Around the World Nativity Scenes in Casco Viejo
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo When I was little, my grandmother used to do a big nativity scene at the lobby of her house for Christmas. My brother, cousin and I participated putting it together, filling up the “town” with “residents” made of every toy we could find. So if you looked closer, you had...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

When I was little, my grandmother used to do a big nativity scene at the lobby of her house for Christmas.  My brother, cousin and I participated putting it together, filling up the “town” with “residents” made of every toy we could find. So if you looked closer, you had on the same “land in time” small green soldiers, dinosaurs and probably a couple of Transformers right next to the classic donkeys, cows, sheep and baby Jesus. After finishing hers, a super treat was to go see other people`s nativity scenes. I remember this guy who used the whole garage, and it was awesome: every single detailed was perfect, he even included at some point working fountains and mills. I think he also had dinosaurs.

Keeping with the holiday spirits, yesterday Casco Viejo`s Neighborhood Association (AVACA) organized a small event to visit the amazing collection of around the world nativity scenes of the Lewis family. Members of AVACA could admire hundreds of big and small scenes from literally everywhere: Europe, Africa, America, Asia, Australia. It was fun to see each one`s interpretation of that single event, and how beautifully each one spoke of its own culture. There was also the “baby corner”, my favorite version made with little rubber ducks.

Thanks so much to the Lewis family for allowing AVACA to come in and enjoy this unique collection!

item.title: Casco Viejo Balcony Memories from the 50`s
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo This week I`ve been taking care of my nephew at my grandmother`s house. One of the many treats of doing it, is that I get to take a look at our old family albums with photos from when the family lived in Calle 6ta, next to the Canal Museum, back...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

This week I`ve been taking care of my nephew at my grandmother`s house. One of the many treats of doing it, is that I get to take a look at our old family albums with photos from when the family lived in Calle 6ta, next to the Canal Museum, back then the Mail & Telegraphy headquarters.

My dad, when thinking back at his childhood, always referred at that balcony fondly, the time spend there with friends and family.  But only yesterday, while looking at the albums I could find a glimpse of those memories, as I found two photos of them having fun, as we say in Spanish: “balconeando”.  Here they are! in one of them you can see Plaza Catedral at the back. On the other one, today`s “Casa Mallet” at A Avenue and 6th.

One of my dad`s famous anecdotes was that one day, while my grandma was working at the Telegraphy she saw my dad (and probably others) riding the balcony as horses. Yep. You can imagine the rest of the story, better spelled as t.r.o.u.b.l.e…  why am I not surprised?

item.title: Delicious Celebrations at American Trade Hall
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.category: What to do in Casco Viejo
item.description: Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Mother`s day at the American Trade Hall in Casco Viejo was awesome: music, kids running around getting their faces painted, mimosas in every hand, excellent food and desserts. The place looked like a war zone afterwards, kids happily asleep, exhausted after playing so much. Some, like my nephews where still...
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Mother`s day at the American Trade Hall in Casco Viejo was awesome: music, kids running around getting their faces painted, mimosas in every hand, excellent food and desserts.  The place looked like a war zone afterwards, kids happily asleep, exhausted after playing so much. Some, like my nephews where still going… but they are like that battery TV commercial with the pink bunny and the drum… I wished I had brought my dog Chispa, I think she is the only one that can match their energy levels!

item.title: Recycling Program in Casco Viejo… getting ready for Christmas!
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo AVACA, Casco Viejo`s neighborhood association has been for the last 3 years doing projects to attack the littering and garbage management in the neighborhood. This year, their flag program is recycling, which has proven to quickly catch up, pulling out of the streets about 10,000 pounds of recyclable material in...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

AVACA, Casco Viejo`s neighborhood association has been for the last 3 years doing projects to attack the littering and garbage management in the neighborhood.  This year, their flag program is recycling, which has proven to quickly catch up, pulling out of the streets about 10,000 pounds of recyclable material in less than 3 months.

Last weekend, a group of volunteers helped get the space ready for the massive Christmas celebrations. The space is all color coded now, tanks in place. A few things to finalize will be ready by next week… and then… bring us your garbage! (please make sure the material is clean… no milk inside the tetrapack!!!)  no need to see glass, plastic and specially cardboard boxes on the streets.

The recycling center is located at the Santa Familia building, at 4th street and A Avenue. If you are coming with a lot of material, you can use the entrance at 5th street by the parking lot.

If you are interested in participating, contact Jennifer at director@avaca.org.pa and she`ll put you in touch with the garbage team.

item.title: Social Program in Casco Viejo wins the Finantial Times City Urban ingenuity Awards
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Just announced this week, a source of pride for everyone working/ supporting Fundacion Calicanto in Casco Viejo: their CAPTA program won the FT City Urban Ingenuity Awards for Latinamerica. What is CAPTA? in Spanish: Capacitación para el Trabajo. This program trains women from Casco Viejo to be able to break...
item.content:encoded:
Panama Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Just announced this week,  a source of pride for everyone working/ supporting Fundacion Calicanto in Casco Viejo: their CAPTA program won the FT City Urban Ingenuity Awards for Latinamerica.

What is CAPTA? in Spanish: Capacitación para el Trabajo. This program trains women from Casco Viejo to be able to break the cycle of poverty by themselves. First, they give them the personal tools (self esteem) and then professional tools.  Want to know more? check their Facebook page HERE

item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Young Panamanian dancers debut as choreographers tonight, at “Young Choreographers” contemporary dance performance at the Anita Villalaz Theater in Plaza Francia.  Donation; $5.

All this week: Flea Market at Casa Góngora, in pro of Olga Sinclair Foundation.  Furniture, clothing, accesories, paintings and more, Casa Góngora is inviting you to pass by and get your Christmas presents while helping the Foundation. They also have exposed on their upper floor an interesting collection including beautiful balconies of Casco Viejo made by Ida Vallarino. It is amazing the work that was put in each one, we were impressed by the level of detail and accuracy with some of the old photos.

item.title: American Trade Hotel in Casco Viejo Opens its Doors!
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Simply the most ambitious and beautiful restoration done to date in Casco Viejo. A delicate blend of Panama`s tropical culture with contemporary style. Inside and outside connect through triple height glass windows, lush tropical plants inside echo with Plaza Herrera`s big trees. Thoughtful details everywhere, my favorite being the old...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Simply the most ambitious and beautiful restoration done to date in Casco Viejo.  A delicate blend of Panama`s tropical culture with contemporary style.  Inside and outside connect through triple height glass windows, lush tropical plants inside echo with Plaza Herrera`s big trees.  Thoughtful details everywhere, my favorite being the old style library, where books have been cherry picked by the owners evoking the golden era of travel, back when it really meant exploring. You`ll find books from pioneers telling their tales of joy, struggle and wonder. You`ll also find a pool, a gym, and a jazz bar (opening soon!).

I should do a post only on the American Trade History. But I`m so excited that for now I`m just going to post some of my photos…

item.title: Brunch n`Tango: Mother`s Day in Casco Viejo
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.category: What to do in Casco Viejo

How to celebrate with something different? well, Casco Viejo might be your place to be! American Trade Hotel will have a fabulous brunch at their Art Deco events hall, including jazz and a kid`s...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

This Sunday, December 8th is one of the big holiday celebrations of Latin America: Mother`s day.  How to celebrate with something different? well, Casco Viejo might be your place to be!

American Trade Hotel will have a fabulous brunch at their Art Deco events hall, including jazz and a kid`s corner with Story Telling. And starting at 4:30 p.m. Tango lovers will gather at Plaza Catedral to dance at “Milonga en el Gazebo” by Tango Panama!

Spend a full day in Casco and have a blast..

Photo source: Tango Panama Facebook Page

item.title: Christmas is Here!
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón

I was walking around yesterday, when all of the sudden the SPI band started playing in the plaza. They marched all the way to Plaza Herrera and did a small but fabulous concert! Christmas carols...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

I love December in Panama, and specially here in Casco where things just happen unexpectedly. I was walking around yesterday, when all of the sudden the SPI band started playing in the plaza. They marched all the way to Plaza Herrera and did a small but fabulous concert! Christmas carols with salsa and jazz rhythms. Increíble…

Officially starting the season, this Saturday will be the annual Carol by Candlelight event, this year to fundraise for the children of Malambo and Santo Tomás Hospital. Find out more HERE.  It has grown so much since they started a few years ago at Plaza Francia! this year it will be held at Cinta Costera by the Plaza Cincuentenario. Here is the info of the participants:

item.title: My 2013 Eco Christmas Tree
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Each Christmas I take on making my own Christmas tree. I have already done newspaper, plastic bottles, cans, glass bottles and even using beach pebbles (with the cans). Although the first versions where medium size trees, since I moved I`m more into mini versions. Recently I bumped into them at...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Each Christmas I take on making my own Christmas tree. I have already done newspaper, plastic bottles, cans, glass bottles and even using beach pebbles (with the cans).  Although the first versions where medium size trees, since I moved I`m more into mini versions.  Recently I bumped into them at Pinterest, what an amazing moment, to see myself pinned and re pinned!

This year, I decided to go “beach style” and use found things at the beach, adding to other stuff I had at home. From plastic hearts and sandals to CocaCola polar bears, here is my Mini Eco Christmas Tree for 2013. I`m also adding a center piece with plastic stars that I found also at the beach. I`ve used them every year (as chandelier and general decoration). This time, I decided to go with a small centerpiece and see how it looked. Love it!

item.title: Florist in Casco Viejo
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Did you know there is a florist in Casco Viejo? we visited her store in Calle 12 and A Avenue last week with a group we were touring. I enjoy Calle 12 a lot because it has several of those old trades: there is at least one shoe guy, two...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Did you know there is a florist in Casco Viejo? we visited her store in Calle 12 and A Avenue last week with a group we were touring. I enjoy Calle 12 a lot because it has several of those old trades: there is at least one shoe guy, two tailors and the florist.  The name of the shop is La Decorativa, and you can make your orders by email or cellphone. They have done several events for Hotel Ejecutivo, a corporate hotel out of Casco, including small corporate meetings and even weddings.  Contact them at: fdecorativas@hotmail.es  They speak Spanish only! but if you go there and point out what you need I`m sure they`ll figure it out.

Since today is AVACA`s 7th Thanksgiving celebration, I take it as an omen of a fantastic...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

I can´t remember when I saw my last rainbow, but yesterday seemed perfect for it: at 5 p.m. Casco Viejo`s skies had this beautiful golden light, but with thin clouds, producing a large rainbow. Since today is AVACA`s 7th Thanksgiving celebration, I take it as an omen of a fantastic party! Lucky Seven… Happy Thanksgiving to everyone!

item.title: Mother`s Day at American Trade Hotel, Casco Viejo

item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Mother`s day always brings joy and stress at the same time. What to do? where to go? how to pick a place where everyone in the family has a space, children, babies, aunties, grandmas, moms of all ages? Our suggestion: nowhere better than American Trade Hotel. Not only they`ll have...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Mother`s day always brings joy and stress at the same time. What to do? where to go? how to pick a place where everyone in the family has a space, children, babies, aunties, grandmas, moms of all ages?  Our suggestion: nowhere better than American Trade Hotel.  Not only they`ll have a great buffet by awarded chef Clara Icaza, but they`ll make the whole thing easy for you with valet parking and an “activity room” for children with “cuenta cuentos” (storytellers) that will help keep the young ones entertained.

Live music by Luis Carlos Pérez Quartet!

Can´t miss it!

Art Tuesdays! Tonight, performing arts at Tántalo: Panamachete. Next Tuesday, the best of Congo culture at Teatro Amador. A bit of Panama`s diverse culture!

item.title: Casco Waking Up to a Beautiful Day
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo As summer makes its way into Panama (when the rest of the universe is going into cold winter), mornings have an early start. The sun comes out half hour early and goes down half hour early, probably the only “daylight”difference you`ll find throughout the year. I woke up and took...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

As summer makes its way into Panama (when the rest of the universe is going into cold winter), mornings have an early start. The sun comes out half hour early and goes down half hour early, probably the only “daylight”difference you`ll find throughout the year.

I woke up and took my camera to Las Bovedas, as the sky was so pretty. The streetlights were still on, they looked like candles in a birthday cake, soon to be blown away. The expectation of a beautiful day builds up in everyone lucky to be looking out at the right moment.

item.title: Amazing model of Casco Viejo shown at University of Panama
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Dom Cartooch is a French artist who lived in Casco for years. At some point I saw him roaming around with a meassuring tape and students sometimes with him, and I wasn´t really sure what he was up to other than modeling some buildings. But it wasn´t just “some buildings”…...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Dom Cartooch is a French artist who lived in Casco for years.  At some point I saw him roaming around with a meassuring tape and students sometimes with him, and I wasn´t really sure what he was up to other than modeling some buildings.  But it wasn´t just “some buildings”… it was the entire historic site of Casco Antiguo!

What an amazing task!

This week, the 9 mt x 6 mt model is being shown at the University of Panama, Architecture Faculty. The project was done together with Peruvian Erasmo Benoutte and will be at the University until November 26.  The challenge will be bringing this to Casco (as it is so big!) and having it be a permanent exhibit somewhere.

Congratulations Dom and Erasmo! Check out the article with photos here:

http://www.prensa.com/impreso/vivir/casco-antiguo-miniatura/225874

item.title: San Felipe Neri Church Open To The Public
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo One of my favorite churches in Casco Viejo, the San Felipe Neri church is open (finally!) to the public. From 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. you`ll be able to go in and experience the beauty of its intimate ambiance. Built in 1688 it has so far 325 years. Take a...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

One of my favorite churches in Casco Viejo, the San Felipe Neri church is open (finally!) to the public.  From 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. you`ll be able to go in and experience the beauty of its intimate ambiance.  Built in 1688 it has so far 325 years. Take a look at the altar, but specially the chorus at the back of the church. Each part of this church has a story to tell,  specially those buried inside (so be careful where you step!).  Graves dating from 1850`s and probably before, people who lived through so many changes.

Every time I visit this church it reminds me of how quickly and dramatically the world has changed, from charcoal to electricity, from smoke to penicillin, from imperialism to democracy. But somehow there is a sense of stillness when you stand there, in its humble quietness.

Enjoy!

item.title: Panama`s Flag and Patriot Holidays

item.description: Casco Viejo Panama Casco Antiguo Patriot Holidays are here! Never mind that the independence (Panama from Spain) happened in 1821 and the separation...
item.content:encoded:
Casco Viejo Panama Casco Antiguo

Patriot Holidays are here! For me it is still amazing that a country managed to have its independence from one country, separation from another, flag days and more compounded in one month. Yes, that is Panama! Never mind that the independence (Panama from Spain) happened in 1821 and the separation (Panama from Colombia) in 1903.

However, few know that the current version of Panama`s flag (blue, red, white and stars) was not the first version. There were a couple before that, and at least one part of a conspiracy.  The final (and current version) has a beautiful story though: it symbolizes the peace between Panama`s two rivaling parties (Conservative and Liberal) which would be the foundation of the new country. That is why white is between both red and blue pavilions, a nation of peace under one flag.

Happy holiday weekend!

If you would like to learn more, check out the story here.

Prototype by Bunau Varilla:

Current Flag:

item.title: Children`s Art at Silent Auction
item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón
item.description: Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo Last night we went to a beautiful silent auction: art pieces made by children from Fundación Calicanto`s dance program called Enlaces. The pieces were made by the children while dancing: canvases stretched on the floor and on the wall, while the children danced with feet and hands wet in paint. ...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Casco Viejo, Casco Antiguo

Last night we went to a beautiful silent auction: art pieces made by children from Fundación Calicanto`s dance program called Enlaces.

The pieces were made by the children while dancing: canvases stretched on the floor and on the wall, while the children danced with feet and hands wet in paint.  The video was fabulous and so were the results!

The paintings will be exhibited at Tántalo for a couple of weeks, so if you are in Casco Viejo, please pass by. It was a very exciting event, congratulations to Enlaces and to all the teachers and companies who supported it. But specially to everyone who placed a bet and bought. Thanks for supporting the program!

item.dc:creator: Patrizia Pinzón

We were there because of the PRISMA dance festival: they had scheduled a performance at the plaza`s gazebo. While waiting, I took some photos of the whole...
item.content:encoded:
Panama, Santa Ana, Casco Viejo

I enjoy Santa Ana. It is a mess, but I really like it. The plaza is full of trees, and people just “hangs”.  We were there because of the PRISMA dance festival: they had scheduled a performance at the plaza`s gazebo. While waiting, I took some photos of the whole scene: kids playing with umbrellas, some old folks fully engaged in their board game. The music started and people piled up.  I wished I had a better camera, just to take photos of their faces and expressions! art at work…
